business.headline: HDB Financial Services eyes IPO worth $7–8 billion by end of FY24: ReportThe IPO is expected to be a mix of secondary sale and fresh capital, aiming for a valuation in the range of $7–8 billion.

Shree Tirupati Balajee IPO: All you need to know before subscribingShree Tirupati Balajee's IPO is a book-built issue comprising a fresh issue of 1.48 crore shares totalling Rs 122.43 crore and an offer for sale of 57 lakh shares amounting to Rs 47.23 crore.

54th GST Council meeting: What's on the agenda?These meetings have focused on various important issues, including tax rates on hybrid vehicles, life insurance premiums, and challenges within the textiles and pharmaceuticals sectors.

Another SME IPO in spotlight over 135x subscription. Details hereBoss Packing Solutions, which supplies packaging machines, labelling, capping, and filling equipment, had an issue size of a little over Rs 8 crore.

Motilal Oswal launches Nifty 500 Momentum 50 Index Fund. Check details The Nifty 500 Momentum 50 Index follows a momentum investing strategy, which involves selecting stocks that have shown strong performance recently.

Nvidia's market value drops $279 billion. How much did CEO Jensen Huang lose?Despite the loss on Tuesday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's wealth has still grown by $51 billion so far this year, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Ebix becomes debt-free after acquisition by Eraaya LifeSpacesEbix's successful restructuring and debt-free status mark a new chapter for the company, setting the stage for continued growth and investment in its business operations globally.

Sebi employees accuse top leadership of creating toxic work environment: Report Sebi employees alleged that "shouting, scolding, and public humiliation have become a norm in meetings," creating a hostile atmosphere that has negatively impacted their mental health and work-life balance.

India's services sector growth jumps to 5-month high in August Despite this, companies in the services sector remained optimistic about future demand, although their confidence dipped to its lowest in over a year.
Sensex, Nifty decline as IT shares plunge; Coal India down over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 404.78 points to 82,150.66 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 136.35 points to trade at 25,143.50.

Risk-takers or safety seekers: Deep dive into Gen Z investment trendsAccording to a report by a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), 55% of cryptocurrency investors are Gen Zs. Additionally, 41% of investments in stocks and 25% of investments in NFTs are made by Gen Zs.
Intel at risk of losing spot in blue-chip Dow Jones index as shares plungeThe Dow Jones index, known for its price-weighted methodology, is heavily influenced by stock prices.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as investors remain cautious; financials gainThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 4.40 points lower to end at 82,555.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.15 points to close at 25,279.85.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Decoding Rahul Gandhi's meet with wrestlers Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang PuniaThe meeting with Rahul Gandhi has intensified speculation that Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia may enter electoral politics in the upcoming Haryana Assembly election.

BJP's first candidate list for Haryana out, Nayab Saini to contest from LadwaHaryana minister Anil Vij has been fielded from the Ambala Cantt Assembly constituency while BJP Rajya Sabha MP Kiran Choudhury's daughter Shruti Chaudhury has got the party ticket to contest the Tosham seat.

How arms for Nato are ending up with gangs and terrorists in IndiaPolice recovered a pistol meant for Nato forces from two people in Punjab with criminal records last week. The spotting of such a firearm in India, however, is not an isolated one. Seizures in India of US-made weapons and those for Nato forces reveal the role of Pakistan-backed operatives in arms smuggling.

From the archives: How 155 passengers and crew on hijacked IC 814 were freedThe raging controversy over OTT series 'IC-814: The Kandahar Hijack' takes us back to the riveting tale of anguish, anxiety and articulate negotiation leading up to the safe return of the hijacked Indian Airlines plane to Delhi

Beyond the grocery rush: What's fuelling India's instant delivery boom?Quick commerce is changing the retail landscape in India—imagine getting everything from snacks to electronic gadgets at your door in minutes. It's fast, it's fierce, and it's here to stay.

Union Minister's dig at Bangladesh over regime change: 'Investors won't go there'While addressing an event in New Delhi, Giriraj Singh also said that if Bangladesh becomes like Pakistan, investors will think before going there.

The spy on IC 814 who was a ghost passenger in Kandahar hijack Shashi Bhushan Singh Tomar's name wasn't among the names released to the public by the team managing the IC 814 Kandahar hijack. The reason was that he was the RAW station head in Kathmandu. Had the hijackers come to know that Shashi Bhushan was on IC 814, he wouldn't have been let off alive.

Indian-origin grandfather in UK dies after assault, 5 minors arrestedBhim Kohli, an 80-year-old Indian-origin man, died after being attacked by five minors while he was walking his dog in Franklin Park, in eastern England. The children, aged 12 and 14, were arrested on suspicion of murder. Kohli suffered a fatal neck injury and died a day after the attack.

New eye drops could replace reading glasses and treat this diseaseIndia's drug regulatory agency has approved new eye drops to help people with presbyopia remove the need for reading glasses. This condition affects over a billion people in the world.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Company that works with Amazon, Facebook confirms your phone is listening to youThe firm whose clients include Facebook and Amazon has confirmed that there is an Active Listening software that places ads on user's device.

IndiGo passenger asks Tamil pilot to make in-flight announcement in Hindi. Viral videoAn IndiGo passenger asked a Tamil pilot to make an in-flight announcement in Hindi. The video of his earnest attempt has charmed the internet.
Maruti Suzuki Swift CNG launch in second week of September | ExclusiveMaruti currently sells 14 CNG models in India.

Campaign to boost Indian-American votes by one million ahead of US electionsThe "Indo-American Votes Matter" campaign has been launched by the Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies (FIIDS) to encourage Indian-American voters to participate in the US presidential elections. The campaign aims to register one million Indian-American voters, survey their policy views, and ensure their voices are heard by both parties.

Akhilesh Yadav's 'bulldozer in Gorakhpur' jab gets Yogi Adityanath's sharp replyAkhilesh Yadav criticised Yogi Adityanath's use of bulldozers in governance and vowed to redirect them to Gorakhpur after the 2027 elections if the Samajwadi Party wins.
He drugged his wife and called 72 strangers to rape her. Now, she's speaking outThe woman was unaware of the abuse until police informed her four years ago. She stated she has no memory of the rapes.

Ram Charan to Prabhas: Telugu stars donate to Telangana, Andhra relief fundsTop Telugu actors Ram Charan, Allu Arjun, and Prabhas have donated a total of Rs 4 crore to the CM Relief Fund to aid flood-affected regions in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

IC 814 hijacker, who killed Rupin Katyal, tried to convert passengers to IslamShakir, the IC 814 hijacker who went by the code name 'Doctor' and was the most brutal of the five terrorists, gave speeches in which he tried to convert the passengers to Islam. Shakir, who slit the throat of newly-wed Rupin Katyal, said "Islam is a better religion, much better than Hinduism".

Supreme Court questions ED on denying accused access to key documentsThe Supreme Court on Wednesday questioned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) about the denial of crucial documents to accused individuals during bail proceedings, raising concerns about potential violations of their fundamental right to liberty under Article 21.

Bloodstains on Darshan's clothes, Pavithra Gowda's slippers: Police chargesheetIn the chargesheet submitted in court in Renukaswamy murder case, the police have cited over 200 pieces of circumstantial evidences, including forensic reports of bloodstains on the clothes of Darshan and on the slippers of Pavithra Gowda.

IC 814 survivors say Netflix series shows truth but not all of what went down Rakesh and Pooja Kataria, who spoke to India Today TV, were a young couple at the time of the incident. They were returning home from their honeymoon in Nepal. The couple asserted that the codenames used for the hijackers in the Netflix series is true.

Anushka Sharma 'feels great' as she returns to Mumbai, talks about her comfort foodBollywood actor Anushka Sharma is back in Mumbai and delighted to reconnect with her fans. She also talked about her comfort food.

Kareena Kapoor to Deepika Padukone: Bollywood's maternity photoshoot trendCelebrity pregnancy photoshoots have always taken the internet by storm. From Deepika Padukone to Kareena Kapoor Khan, take a look at Bollywood's top maternity photoshoots.

sports.headline: McCullum as England all-format coach an 'unbelievable move': Ben StokesBen Stokes welcomed the move of making Brendon McCullum the head coach of England's white-ball teams. McCullum took charge after Matthew Mott stepped down following the T20 World Cup 2024.

Dravid, Kumble, Srinath address match referees seminar at NCAFormer India captains Anil Kumble and Rahul Dravid led a seminar at the National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru, addressing match referees on game management. The session included input from ICC match referee Javagal Srinath and Elite Panel umpire Nitin Menon.

When Sharad Kumar's Ukrainian coach broke down after his Paralympics silverIndia's Sharad Kumar revealed how his Ukrainian coach Nikitin Yevhen almost broke down in tears after hearing about his silver medal win at the Paris Paralympics 2024. Sharad has been separated from Yevhen after the Ukraine-Russia war started.

Stokes trying to give himself a chance to recover before Pakistan Tests English Test skipper Ben Stokes said that he would not do anything that would aggravate his injury before the Test series against Pakistan later this year.

Manolo Marquez wants India to grow out of 'boring football' in match vs SyriaIndian football team head coach Manolo Marquez wants his team to grow after their drab show against Mauritius. Pakistan board to conduct fitness tests before awarding contracts to playersThe Pakistan Cricket Board will conduct stringent fitness tests before awarding central contracts for the next 12 months. This will include currently contracted players and other international and domestic performers.

Rahul Dravid set to be appointed Rajasthan Royals head coach for IPL 2025Rahul Dravid is set to become the head coach of Rajasthan Royals for IPL 2025. The former Indian cricketer will be reuniting with Sanju Samson, who is expected to continue as captain.

Archer Sheetal Devi celebrates Paralympics medal with motherIndia's para-archer Sheetal Devi thanked her mother for unwavering support, after securing a bronze medal at the Paris Paralympics. Her victory in the mixed team compound event highlights her rise as a future star in para-archery.

World champion Sachin Khilari wins silver with Asian Record in ParisParalympics 2024: India's Sachin Khilari clinched the silver medal in men's shot put F46 event on Wednesday, September 4. The world champion's 16.32m throw was the best that an Asian has ever thrown in the F46 category.

ICC Test Rankings: Babar Azam slips out of top 10 for first time in 5 yearsICC Test Rankings: Former captain Babar Azam dropped out of the top 10 in the batting charts for the first time since December 2019. Babar has not hit a fifty in his last 16 innings in Test cricket.

UP government announces plan to build 18 football stadiums to boost sportUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath pledged the state government's commitment to elevating football in the state. In a landmark announcement, the CM Adityanath said 18 new football stadiums across the state's 18 commissariats.

Lyon suggests new format for WTC: '3-Test final at 3 different venues'Australian spinner Nathan Lyon suggests a three-match World Test Championship (WTC) Final across different venues, aiming to enhance competitiveness and fairness by allowing teams to adapt to varying conditions and recover from potential setbacks.

Pakistan slip to 59-year low after 2-0 series loss to Bangladesh at homeICC Test Rankings: Pakistan slipped two spots to No. 8 in the latest rankings, updated on Wednesday, September 04. The decline came after Pakistan were whitewashed 2-0 at home by Bangladesh on Tuesday.

Paralympics: Indian badminton contingent gets tremendous welcome in DelhiThe Indian badminton contingent arrived the New Delhi after a tremendous run in the Paris Paralympics on Wednesday, September 4. The contingent was greeted at the IGI Airport amidst much fanfare by the fans and family members of the athletes.

Indian challenge ends as Rohan Bopanna knocked out in mixed doubles semisUS Open 2024: Rohan Bopanna and his Indonesian partner Aldila Sutjiadi were knocked out in the mixed doubles semi-final. The Indo-Indonesia pair lost to American pair of Donald Young and Taylor Townsend 3-6, 4-6

Watch: PM Modi speaks to armless archer Sheetal Devi after Paralympics medalParalympics: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Sheetal Devi via a phone call and congratulated her for her success at the Paralympic Games in Paris. Sheetal won the mixed team compound archery bronze with Rakesh Kumar in Paris. The armless archer said she was happy to have her mother in Paris during her maiden Games appearance.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
